intro: Christolea baiogoinensis, commonly known as the Baiao Guinean Christolea, is a species of flowering plant native to West Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in swampy or marshy areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
